poem:
### Screen Adolescence

flickering heartbeats—  
a teen nation under surveillance  
wretches on virtual waves,   
their burdens stream   
in pixelated moments—  
a cheese sandwich,  
bitter in potential   
as the pause before tears—  
chasms of growing pains  
etched in digital glow,  
a drama unfolds,   
toxic shadows,  
tapping our screens.
